fields.summary: Updating 1.9.2 up to 1.9.4.1 - hotfix.   Crashes the app when it tries to install.

fields.description: I have a submodule which I don't control and want to ignore. I can use git update-index --assume-unchanged on the submodule or edit the .gitmodules and add ignore=dirty and use --assume-unchanged on that to essentially keep this folder deleted. this works fine until I branch my code. When I do that sourcetree automatically does a full checkout recursive on this submodule so it pulls it down polluting my repo. Could we add a flag to not do this?
fields.summary: Option to not checkout submodules when creating a branch

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Click on one of the commit in the Commit Graph
# Try to resize the bottom left panel to be smaller than it is allowed
# Close SourceTree and reopen it again
The bottom left panel collapse intermittently
fields.summary: Bottom left panel collapse intermittently

fields.description:
i need a simple way to compare two revisions of one file from different commits.
i can Log file and i'll see all commits with his entries. I can select 2 commits using cmd+click command. but i don't have External Diff button to compare this revisions at more clear view. it is not comfortable for me to use internal diff viewer.

as decision - just add External Diff button in Log view and open it in other tool, but do not hide Log view. i should have ability to return to Log view after i closed Diff tool.
fields.summary: As user i want to have ability to compare file from different commits more simple way

fields.description:
When installing a fresh-copy of the most recent SourceTree(1.9.4) on OSX, can't get any windows/dialogs to display in order to create a repo.

Secondary windows/dialogs, such as Preferences, About, etc, *do* display.

Related: on another computer which was previously running an older version of SourceTree, upgrading to 1.9.4 did not present this problem

Workaround: installing 1.9.3 seems to be working
http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/SourceTree_1.9.3.dmg

Problem described in more detail here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/303097/sourcetree-opens-but-doesn-t-show-the-application-window
fields.summary: v1.9.4 fresh-install is totally unusable

fields.description:
I am rising the issue as Major as it is real pain in the arse.
I have also seen many posts by other people about the problem.
fields.summary: Hide Remote Branches option setting is not kept after clicking in different branch just for viewing.

fields.description:
After the last upgrade, when I start SourceTree I just get twice a popup with this message:

'git log' failed with code -1:'Couldn't posix_spawn: error 8

for both new repositories or repo I already had bookmarked. I tried removing all the content in ~/Library/Application Support/SourceTree as suggeted somewhere but this didn't work, I just lost all my bookmark but the problem remain.


V.
fields.summary: Startup Problem: 'git log' failed with code -1:'Couldn't posix_spawn: error 8

fields.summary: Crash when updating from 1.9.3.1 to 1.9.4

fields.description: I would like to search the list of of commits by search terms in the commit message. We mark our commits by issue number and do code reviews once an issue is completed. To find all the relevant commits it would be nice to have a searchable commit list.
fields.summary: As a User I want to search for commits so I can find all commits containing a search term.

fields.description: after an update, I can not see the main window of sourcetree, I tried re-installing but it does not work
fields.summary: can´t open main window source tree

fields.description:
Viewing file stage via the "split view staging" layout persists the "Staged files" and "Unstaged files" areas, each of which have a top level checkbox to stage/unstage all child files.

The "Staged files" checkbox appears to always be selected, even when this area is empty - and cannot be unchecked (doing so immediately returns it to checked state).  This causes some visual confusion as it implies that there's something staged.

The larger UX issue here is the abuse of checkboxes.  The fact that Staged files' checkbox can never be unselected, and Unstaged files' checkbox never selected should hint that a different control be used: A "stage/unstage all" button that performs an action but doesn't imply state (as checkboxes do), perhaps?
fields.summary: Split view staging / Staged files always selected

fields.description:
The “flat list (multiple column)” file views do not exhibit consistent behaviour amongst their various incarnations:

• in the Log or Search Views, when viewing an existing commit, the “filename” and “path” columns may be interchanged left-to-right by dragging and dropping. (This is desirable behaviour.)
• in the Log View when viewing the working copy, or in the File Status View, the columns cannot be re-ordered. (This is a regression from 1.8.1.)

In addition, the content is more difficult to scan visually (due to the smaller proportional font and unnecessary horizontal row dividers), but I believe that's covered in a different issue.
fields.summary: Some “flat list (multiple column)” views are not re-orderable

fields.description:
In recent SourceTree versions "Select all files when selecting commit" option stopped working - when browsing commits I see only the first file in the list of files in selected. Consequently, only this single file diff is displayed on the right. Previously, when browsing commits all files were selected so the entire commit diff was displayed on the right.

Here's a short screencast: https://www.dropbox.com/s/94s2aw0hmkw3sc7/SourceTree.mov
fields.summary: "Select all files when selecting commit" stopped working, only first file in commit is selected

fields.description:
When I select "Current Branch" from the little popup above the log view, then switch branches, SourceTree forgets my selection and reverts to "All Branches".
 
This is a huge issue for us, since our git repository is extraordinarily large (10's of gigabytes), and walking through history takes a very long time.
fields.summary: History popup always reverts to "All Branches" instead of staying on "Current Branch"

fields.description:
In the working copy view the diff on the right side only updates after scrolling one of the left side lists. Neither (un)staging nor selecting a different file updates the view on right.

This seems to affect all view options.
fields.summary: Diff view in working copy only updates when scrolling

fields.description: The diff view in Sourcetree is pretty basic. While not a diff/merge-tool it would be very nice if diff-view provided more feedback. Like highlight actual character differences in similar lines.
fields.summary: Diff should highlight char differences in similar lines

fields.description:
It may take a long time to clone a big repo, but i can't know if source tree is still working. Why not show the progress bar instead of the animation of a bar?
Even command line of 'git clone' has sort of way displaying the percentage.
fields.summary: As a git user, I need progress bar when cloning a repo

fields.description:
As per summary.

The flat list version both work but the tree view one doesn't.
fields.summary: Tree view in the commit details file list has no right-click context menu

fields.description:
It would be great if Subtree links within Sourcetree would be transferable inbetween workstations. 

Usecase:
- Link several Subtrees to Sourcetree
- Push 
- Clone Project on another system in Sourcetree

Expected behaviour:
- Subtree links (should) re-apear within Sourcetree

Actual behaviour:
- Subtrees are not linked with Sourcetree on 2nd system
fields.summary: Transferable Subtree Links

fields.description: After installing a Sourcetree update, all the links to Subtree's are gone within Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Subtree links lost after installing Sourcetree update

fields.description:
On the Log View, select Hide Remote Branches.
Click on any local branch on the left panel (except the currently selected one, if any): the option is flipped to Show Remote Branches.
fields.summary: Hide Remote Branches is forgotten

fields.description: if svn user != currently logged in mac osx user, then sourceTree ignores failed osx user credentials and does not pass along the request for svn credentials
fields.summary: SourceTree unable to open SVN repo in this scenario

fields.description:
clone, enter invalid URL
message indicating invalid source path will appear, then press details to open the details message

For a details message that is longer than screen height, the bottom or the details message is cut off, with no ability to scroll and no ability to dismiss details message
fields.summary: Unable to close Details Window

fields.description:
Please make the commit options persistent.

I hate not knowing if the "Sign Commit" option is still on since the previous time I turned it on.  Sometimes it is, sometimes it's not.
fields.summary: Make commit options persistent

fields.description:
Triggering an update from "Check for Updates..." will download the new version, but it will crash once the update is being installed.
This happens every time (even after restarting my machine)
fields.summary: Crash during update from 1.9.3.1 to 1.9.4

fields.description: I love SourceTree and appreciate all the work done to improve it. Considering how well it runs, though, I doubt the bugs fixed in many dot releases are very critical. Please consider pushing dot releases less frequently, to fix important bugs. If you continue posting these releases on the downloads page, developers who want a newer version than the last push will have access, without breaking the workflow regularly for those who are happy with their current version.
fields.summary: Please push releases less frequently

fields.description:
I've got a checked-in file in my repo (in a previous commit) which is located in a folder that is listed in .gitignore.

Bug: Every few actions in SourceTree this file is deleted and shows up in unstaged file as deleted.
fields.summary: SourceTree Deletes Checked In Files that are in gitignore

fields.description:
Classification: Usability

Reproducable: always

Summary: On initial setup, the user is presented with a modal window in which they are asked whether they are willing to send data about their usage. After initial setup, when that option was unchecked, the same setting is checked in the app's preferences.

Steps to Reproduce: 
1) Install Source Tree for Mac
2) Uncheck the "... sending data about your usage" checkbook
3) Finish initial setup
4) cmd-, to get into preferences
5) Observe corresponding checkbox is checked

Expected Results: 
Checkbox in preferences should match the user's decision during setup.
Actual Results: 
The user's decision is not respected.
Regressions: unknown
Notes: 
This may cause a user to trust you less...
fields.summary: unchecking "... sending data about your usage" preference on initial setup is not respected in the regular preferences

fields.description:
I was using outdated version of Source Tree for a while because I could not be bothered to update.

When I updated I got a version that has a new interface, beside the new interface being horrible (while the icon update still is not reversed and we are still using horrible icons) now it is awfully slow to refresh, sometimes I have to close source tree and open again, sometimes I do a rain dance on my office hoping it will refresh, it is very, very annoying.
fields.summary: Working Copy very slow to refresh after interface update

fields.description:
Using a Git repo: Change a file and click on "Working Copy".
Staged files is checked and is always checked regardless of clicking it.
If previous files where staged, the are not visible until clicking "Staged Files" checkbox to unstage them.
fields.summary: Staged checkbox always checked and file list is blank until re-checked

fields.description:
I have a global ~/.hgignore in addition to an .hgignore in my repo. I set up the global ignore like this: http://choorucode.com/2013/02/02/how-to-have-a-global-hgignore-for-mercurial/

In my global .hgignore I have:
 
\.rej$

SourceTree listed a .rej file among my repo's "uncommitted changes". I guess it's ignoring my global ~/.hgignore file, and only looking at the project's .hgignore? I was able to work around this bug by adding the same line to my project's .hgignore.
fields.summary: Global ~/.hgignore is ignored

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Make simple edits to a tracked file
2. Stage one of the hunks
3. UI now displays all hunks in file as both staged and unstaged
4. Unstaging a hunk that was not included in step 2 results in the error below

Error encountered:
'git apply' failed with code 1:'error: patch failed: pom.xml:3
error: pom.xml: patch does not apply

There is also often a loading spinner next to the staged files check box that never goes away.
fields.summary: Staging/Unstaging hunks in the UI do not always update the UI resulting in errors

fields.description:
When I use git-flow and finish a release I would expect to return "develop" branch.

If you don't notice that the branch didn't return to "develop" you might commit stuff on the "master" branch by mistake.

I don't actually know if this is a sourcetreeapp issue or a git-flow tool issue.

Thank you
fields.summary: When I use git-flow and finish a release I would expect to return develop branch

fields.description:
I don't know what to tell you about how this happened but you need to know about it and it doesn't increase my confidence in SourceTree.

I came in this morning and did a pull to bring in all recent changes.  Checking my code I found a file (stored procedure st_sp_fec_timer_read) where the version in my repository wasn't the same that I had pushed yesterday.  I know the changes I made were there because I was using the new version of the procedure in development.

I checked by locating a commit containing the file (searched for "timer" under "File Changes") and then checking its log.

The log shows two entries:
 * The original log entry on 5/29/14 12:29:49pm when the file was first added -- the entire file is the "hunk".
 * The next log entry on 6/2/14 2:37:10pm where I pushed a change -- the changes I made were the "hunk" showing that the old code was replaced by my code.

No other log entries appear for the file at all.  Mine is the last entry

Yet the copy that appears on my local disk is now the old version.  Refer to the attached images.
fields.summary: Local repository copy doesn't match server after pull

fields.description:
When merging branch B into branch A, and if there is a conflict or more, the stage area is empty, but the right pane shows a file selected.

If I nervously tick the checkbox next to the "staged files", or "unstated files", the window refreshes, but the merge flow is broken, forcing me to do a hard reset.

I can solve this by changing the view options, for example switch between "show only conflicts" and "show only pending"
fields.summary: Stage area empty when merging

fields.description: I have a large number of files I want to commit to the stage. It's the start of a project and there are over 14,000 files. When I try to drag them to the stage, or when I try to click on the checkbox to select everything then the program times out. Even selecting a smaller number of files and uploading them to the stage is taking a very long time. I didn't have this problem before upgrading sourcetree from version 1.7.4.
fields.summary: Timeout dragging files to stage

fields.description: Trying to commit changes.  Files are not staged.  Click on the checkbox next to file name to stage it and the file immediately gets deleted.
fields.summary: Clicking to stage a file deletes it

fields.description:
Currently, history of previous commit messages shows all commit messages for all repositories one has contributed to.

However, I would expect to get only those messages shown which are related to the repository I have open and I am committing to.
fields.summary: Previous commit message are not filtered by repository

fields.description:
Notified by SourceTree there was an update available. Said OK. Crashed at install phase, 2X.

I have attached crash logs.

In general, I've found in-app updates extremely unreliable with SourceTree. It's pretty awesome otherwise, though.
fields.summary: Crashes when auto-updating

fields.description:
SourceTree output:

{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v origin master:master 
Pushing to https://<<my_user>>@github.com/<<my_repo>>.git
2014-06-02 11:40:16.047 git-credential-sourcetree[4696:507] Error (internetKeychainItemForServer:withUsername:path:port:protocol:) - The specified item could not be found in the keychain.
{noformat}

Affects fetch, push and pull.

Password Required popup occurs whether the remotes / origin URL format is:

1. https://github.com/<<my_repo>>.git

Or the following as suggested by [this|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/34108/sourcetree-does-not-retrieve-user-name-and-password-from-keychain]
2. https://<<my_user>>@github.com/<<my_repo>>.git

Still had 1.9.2 in my trashcan so tried reverting to that, issue was still present. This is most curious (I do not recall seeing this issue until last Friday, but the date modified of 1.9.2 is 8 May), it suggests there is some kind of existing configuration edge case.

On a different OSX 10.9.3 machine that was still on SourceTree 1.9.2, I do not have this issue, so my guess is updating from 1.9.2 to 1.9.3.1 caused this.
fields.summary: Password Required - Always pops up

fields.description:
When configuring a custom external diff tool the path for the local file is relative to the working directory in contrast to the remote path which is absolute (somewhere located under {{/var/folders}}). 

Some tools (like DeltaWalker) do not support opening files relative do their working directory so assigning an absolute path could fix problems when using these.
fields.summary: Always use absolute paths for external tools
Variable assignments for $LOCAL and $REMOTE the other way round

fields.description:
With version 1.9.x you removed a lot of features from 1.8.1 which are mandatory for working with ST on a daily base. While you pretend to listen to your users feedback and re-introduce some of the features the overall UX doesn't change at all. No, it gets even worse. 

All the logged issues regarding this topic can be solved very easily by rolling back to 1.8.1 and rename the current 1.9. branch to 2.0 and set it into alpha state. Then announce a public beta test period to figure out what your users really want.
fields.summary: Roll back to ST 1.8.1

fields.description:
When I'm trying to stage some but not all files in a list long, I'd like to use the keyboard to select with space.

When I press space to move a file into the staging area, it resets the selected file back to the top, rather than one below, as I would expect/prefer.

screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Selecting a file with space in the staging area resets the cursor to the top

fields.description:
It would be great if the External Diff support was extended to the changeset level so that I could select a changeset and all of the files changed in the changeset would be sent as one batch to the diff tool as two folders being compared.  This would allow the user to stay within their diff tool to review all changes for the changeset, and would allow that diff tool to present a nice file list and/or tabs.

I realize that you can also select the individual files from the log view and select External Diff, but each of these files are sent individually to the diff tool which doesn't make for as nice of an experience.

Thanks
fields.summary: External Diff at Changeset level

fields.description: Please see attached screenshot.  This happens consistently to all my repos.  I can jiggle stuff to get it right again, but it obviously feels janky.
fields.summary: No files to be staged

fields.description: Now that staged and not staged changes are basically in the same list, with a checkbox and a divider that moves as files are added and removed from the staging area, it appears to be impossible select multiple files and drag them to the staging area. I can right click and "add to index", but this is tedious (an extra click and scroll) and not immediately obvious in the list of options especially when the terminology elsewhere is "staged files" and "unstaged files". Even when adding or removing a few files, it can be tedious to click the checkbox for every file individually. Especially when you can't even just keep clicking, because the divider is moving all the time.
fields.summary: It is no longer possible to drag multiple files into the staging area?

fields.description: Typing a search string into the file search box doesn't affect tree views on any of the staging modes. It should filter like the flat views.
fields.summary: Search filter doesn't affect tree views

fields.description:
A number of people are reporting that with 1.9.3 they're getting repeated requests to authorise git-credential-helper for keychain access, and that despite clicking 'Always allow' it carries on prompting. 

I couldn't reproduce this with an existing HTTPS clone of a private repository but when cloning a new one I can reproduce it.
fields.summary: Prompts for permission to access keychain on new https clones

fields.description:
Ever since 1.9.0, staging and committing more than 10 files is terribly slow, giving you the spinner icon in the staging area.

OS X 10.9, no untracked files, three repos open
fields.summary: Extremely slow performance when staging files 1.9.3

fields.description:
1. The ellipsis menu has far fewer items than the right-click menu
2. ...with semi-random order, compared to the right-click menu
3. ...and options are jumbled together with no grouping
4. The ellipsis menu is centered in stead of left-aligned
5. The ellipsis menu has 'Discard' where the right-click menu has 'Revert' (supposedly the same action -- this is for Hg)
6. Even when clicking on directories the ellipsis menu says 'Add/Discard/... file'
7. The ellipsis popup looks like some kind of weird chat or a message bubble instead of a regular popup -- this one is perhaps a personal taste issue but to me it looks out of place.
fields.summary: Multiple issues with the ellipsis menu in the file view

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to do a pull from the bookmarks window without having to open the next window. 

Some repos for me at least have went into maintenance where other developers in our office are making maintenance fixes to files. Since I don't necessarily need to review these changes, click a button on the repos in the bookmarks window would eliminate a step for me.
fields.summary: Pull commits for repo in bookmarks window.

fields.description:
There seems to be an existing Issue about this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-900

but I can't see it in my Diff preferences: http://i.imgur.com/RYLZzQd.png

I am using version 1.9.3 on OS X mavericks
fields.summary: Specify width of tabs in internal diff view per-project

fields.description:
Up to 1.8.x the diff view scrolling was instantaneous and quick. In 1.9.3 there is a noticeable delay before the new view starts scrolling and scrolling itself is also slower than in the previous version, sometimes so slow it fails to register a rapid two-finger swipe at all, sometimes pausing for a short moment and then suddenly jumping up or down.

This makes quick scanning much slower and error-prone as the delay makes the scrolling unpredictable (in particular if it fails to register the scolling gesture at all) and requires much more swiping to get the same result (looks like about 3 times more swipes are required in 1.9 as compared to 1.8).

Combine having to swipe many times more with the delays, sudden jumps and missed gesture recongition and you've got a pretty unpleaseant experience.

This is not a computer performance issue - I just had 1.8 and 1.9 running side by side and the behaviour difference is striking between the two.
fields.summary: Unresponsive and slow scrolling of the file diff panel

fields.description:
In the attached screenshot you will see a commit message shown in sourcetree on the left and the output from git log in the terminal on the right.

The "notes" information is missing.

sourcetree should show all of what is shown in the terminal.

See also http://subgit.com/book-remote/#N2048A
fields.summary: Implement support for git-notes

fields.description:
Reproduce:
- Have a file with two or more unstaged hunks
- Stage one hunk

What happens:
- the hunk is staged
- the staged file is focused
- staged hunk is shown

What I expected
- the hunk is staged
- the unstaged file stays focused
- unstaged hunk(s) are shown
fields.summary: Staging a hunk in Tree Fluid view moves focus to staged file

fields.description: SourceTree crashes on Drag & Drop from Staged to Unstaged or vice versa in Thread + Fluid view.
fields.summary: Crash on Drag & Drop in Tree + Fluid View

fields.description:
Thankfully you have now restored the multiple column and tree views for pending files.
Please also bring back the multiple column view from 1.8.1 for browsing prior revisions.
The single column long path is very hard to scan over.
fields.summary: Bring back multiple column view for browsing prior revisions

fields.description:
SourceTree 1.9.x came with a number of user experience modifications that are unacceptable to many users. While Atlassian seem to be prepared to slowly add back some of the removed and needed features, the fact that they felt it ok to make these changes in first place without any sort of user review shows that Atlassian probably doesn't prioritise SourceTree that much.

I really appreciate the older version 1.8.1 of SourceTree, and making such a great tool available for free has helped making Atlassian a popular company in many places (I know that is true for me personally). I therefore wonder if it is possible for Atlassian to release version 1.8.1 of SourceTree as open source, so the community can continue to work with and develop a great tool? The driving principle for this community development should be to not fix anything that isn't broken, and specifically to not remove features without first verifying with users.

I fully expect this request to be turned down. I ask anyway since I really liked SourceTree and would love to see the great tool continue to be developed.
fields.summary: Release 1.8.1 as open source?

fields.description:
The tooltips on items in the sidebar have a heavy text with a superfluous shadow, making them harder to read fro people with reduced visual acuity.
See attached image.
fields.summary: ToolTip text has unneeded drop shadow, making it hard to read for people with reduced visual acuity

fields.description: Git pull frequently fails on the first attempt, but then works on the second attempt. It's as if Source Tree is dependent on doing the initial fetch to determine what needs to be pull from remote, so that if you Pull before that has fired then it errors out. By the same token, by the time the Pull is attempted Source Tree indicates it knows what's on the server (via the badge icon) and then it works on the second Pull. See screenshot of error.
fields.summary: Git pull frequently fails on the first time

fields.description: It would be good to have possibility to search commits by string. Just an inputs. When there are a lot of commits it's difficult to find something
fields.summary: Search commits by string

fields.description:
In the inline diff view one should be able to show the whitespace characters. That way one would see if a tab got replaced by spaces. One could also review if the correct whitespace characters were used.

Additionally would it be nice if one can select the color of the whitespace characters. I personally prefer it, when they're fading into the background, so that they're not disturb reading the code.
fields.summary: Display whitespace characters

fields.description: When opening the working directory window or when preparing to 'commit' which in this new version shows the same window - the app is way too slow when trying to pull the current modified files, etc.
fields.summary: New version of sourcetree - 1.9.2 seems too slow

fields.description:
Can't stage or unstage the file with CTRL+M in it's name, eg: [Icon^M|^ctrl-m.zip]

Not able to show the file content too
fields.summary: Cannot work on files with CTRL+M in it's name

fields.description:
I would like to see repository actions (eg, fetch, pull, push, commit) available from a repository's action menu in the bookmarks window, so that I can quickly perform those actions without needing to open the repository window.

For example,
- updating the local working directory so that IDE's without VCS can pickup those changes.
- local changes made to a file from the terminal can be quickly committed.
- complex VCS actions performed in a terminal can be pushed to the remote.
fields.summary: Repository actions on bookmark action menu

fields.description: SourceTree appears to crash randomly. Attached crash logs seem to indicate that notification center may be part of the problem.
fields.summary: SourceTree randomly crashes. Logs may indicate Notification Center

fields.description:
If you change your Keyboard system settings from the default so that the tab function moves the keyboard focus through 'All Controls' instead of 'Text boxes and lists only', pressing space to toggle the checkboxes doesn't work in the new file status view. 

This appears to be because Cocoa is already giving the checkbox the focus and toggling it itself (we toggle it usually because the default settings don't do this).
fields.summary: Can't toggle checkboxes with spacebar when Keyboard prefs set to tab through all controls

fields.description:
This generally drives me mental when I find myself working on a project with submodules -- accidentally committing to a detached head.

Please add a feature that blocks users from committing to a detached head.  There is no reason for doing this through a GUI.  If there was a rational reason for doing this sort of commit you could do it from the command line.

If you are realistic about helping people work with submodules this is a critical feature.
fields.summary: Do not allow commits on a detached head

fields.description: When adding a new Hosted Account and selecting Stash as "Hosting Service", it is not possible to select the protocol between HTTP and HTTPS. Assuming that this is by design perhaps it would be better to indicate "HTTP(S)" instead.
fields.summary: "Preferred Protocol" for Stash Hosting Service Should Indicate "HTTP(S)"

fields.description:
I've noticed in a few of my new repo creations lately, that my initial commit didn't do anything.

I also noticed that the checkbox under the commit message in the new-style UI is checked, but is greyed out, and says "push to (null)/master".

I have the General preference 'Push to default/origin remote when committing" turned on, and no remote defined on the repository I'm trying to commit to.

Resolving either of those issues (that is, unchecking the preference, or making a remote) allows me to commit.

However I believe this is a bug as I should be able to commit to a local repository which will never have any remotes, without unchecking that preference.

Please let me know if this is unclear!
fields.summary: Cannot commit if 'push to default remote' is on and no remotes are defined

fields.description: I've been experiencing hangs a few times a day, often when doing nothing more than scrolling some text in the diff window.  The attached report was copied from the report generated when I had to force quit SourceTree.
fields.summary: Hang while scrolling in UI

fields.description:
Original issue: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/291021/sourcetree-no-longer-working-on-10-7

Crash report attached.
fields.summary: EXC_BREAKPOINT crash - _NSWindowDidChangeBackingPropertiesNotification

fields.description: When I commit multiple files at once, only one file is displayed in the checkin record. There is no obvious way to see if any other files have been checked in, nor is it possible to see the differences. Though indicated as minor, I believe that this is much more important, because I have no way of verifying my changes.
fields.summary: Multiple-file commit not indicated

fields.description: When I merge a branch and there are merge conflicts, the commit message often is empty instead of being the default one "merged branch ...".
fields.summary: Merging with Merge Confilicts often Looses Commit Message

fields.description: When SourceTree gets active, it does not automatically refresh file status. The changed files do not appear until I press Cmd+R.
fields.summary: Auto-Refresh Does Not Work

fields.description:
Very often when I mark several files for being staged, the spinner does not disappear, and the files are not staged.
Sometimes it helps to navigate away, uncheck one of the files, and check it again.

This causes major productivity losses since 1.9.x
fields.summary: Staging Files often Hangs

fields.description: When viewing a stash, I want to be able to refresh so the stash list is up to date with the repository. However, the View -> Refresh command is disabled in that view.
fields.summary: Refresh command is disable when viewing a stash

fields.description:
Similar to the native OS X feature where you can bring the app full-screen, I'd like to have a way to bring the diff-view-pane full-window.

It could something similar to what is done in Xcode, where I could make disappear on a whim, in a single button the left-pane (the one containing branches, tags, remotes) and the git log pane.

When I am inspecting a commit, I like to have a lot of space to really see what was done.
fields.summary: As a [Merge in chief] inspecting hunks in the diff-view-pane, I would like to be able to make it bigger using single button

fields.description:
I have a git repository on a remote machine. I mount the directory containing this git repository on my local machine as a network disk using sshfs.

When I open this repository in SourceTree, every now and then all the files in the repository are automatically staged for deletion. This means I have to unstage everything (and I loose whatever I had staged before).
fields.summary: Files get automatically staged for deletion on git repo on (slow) network disk

fields.description: When the first file in a commit is staged, the "Staged files" heading appears and offsets the rest of the modified files one row down. This often trips me when I try to select the _second_ file, which promptly moves out from under the pointer and I end up clicking the file before it, which then is moved into the non-adjacent "staged files" list where I need to locate it again in order to unstage it. It's just an inconvenience, but one that I often struggle with. Probably if the "Staged files" heading is displayed even when empty, or at least a row is reserved for it so that displaying it won't move the UI elements around, would be greatly helpful.
fields.summary: Staging the first file for a commit moves the list of modified files around

fields.description:
I have a local branch ("feature/foo") that tracks a remote branch with a different name (just "foo"). Pulling "feature/foo" works as expected, the tracked remote branch is automatically selected in the "remote branch to pull" dropdown, but when pushing the branch is unselected by default and if I select it for pushing, SourceTree offers to create a new remote branch "feature/foo" instead of using the name of the tracked "foo" remote branch. This is very inconvenient and I expect at some point I'm going to overlook this and end up pushing it as "feature/foo", thus polluting the remote branch namespace shared with other developers who don't use my branch naming scheme.

I've tried to remove and add tracking again, which didn't change the behavior.

My {{.git/config}} settings for the branch:

{code}
[branch "feature/foo"]
	remote = origin
	merge = refs/heads/foo
{code}
fields.summary: Pushing a branch whose tracked remote branch has different name

fields.description:
Related to SRCTREE-2386, where if you close the window the current commit message is lost.

Did I mention, "grr"?
fields.summary: Looses commit message when closing window

fields.description:
Rating as major because it's a major pain in the ....


Click a checkbox to stage a file. Sometimes it works, sometimes not.
The file *is* staged, but that doesn't always show in the UI.

Have to close the window (which incidentally then looses my commit message, grrrr) and then reopen to get it to show up and let me commit.
fields.summary: Doesn't always update UI when staging files

fields.description:
I have several projects where changes are always pushed to "origin/dev" and then reviewed by a QA team. They're in charge of merging them into "origin/stage" and "origin/master" for deployment.

By default, when preparing to push SourceTree selects "origin/master" and a few times I've mistakenly pushed there because I forgot to change the remote branch to "origin/dev".

It would be nice if I could assign the default remote branch per project so I didn't have to remember/change that with every push.

I'm coming from using Gitbox, so forgive me if there's a command to force this. I don't see any way to make that change from SourceTree.
fields.summary: Option to set default remote branch when pushing

fields.description:
Something terribly wrong with new 1.9 release.
Every time I want to stage more than few files Source Tree hangs with ever spinning wheel. It happens regularly.

This slow performance never happened with 1.8.

I am using 8 Core CPU, 16GB RAM, SSD Drive so it is NOT hardware issue.




Example screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Extrememly slow performance when staging files

fields.description:
If there is file deleted only, there is no 'Uncommitted changes' in the Commit Graph.

We will need to modify a file to have 'Uncommitted changes' in the Commit Graph.

This 'Uncommitted changes' for file deleted is needed in the Commit Graph so that we can stage those deleted file in the Log View instead of File Status View.
fields.summary: No Uncommitted changes in Commit Graph when there is only file deleted

fields.description:
My default remote is {{master}}, but when committing I get 'Push changes immediately to dev/master' in the commit interface. If I right click the branch it properly gives 'Push to origin/master (tracked)' as the default push location (note: this is without checking the 'push immediately' checkbox on commit - when I had this checked it would change the tracking remote).

My guess is that it is just picking the first remote alphabetically, rather than the actual tracking remote.
fields.summary: 'Push changes immediately' picks wrong remote when committing

fields.description:
I have the setting _push to default remote/origin when committing_ set, but now when I open a git repo that does (yet) have a remote, that checkbox is still checked but disabled. Clicking commit does not perform any action and shows no warning, it just fails silently. As soon as I `git remote add ...` it starts working. This can easily be replicated with any freshly initialized git repo.

BTW arriving at this bug tracker from clicking _Raise a Support Ticket_ from within SourceTree is quite the task and IMHO not a good advertisement for Jira. :(
fields.summary: Commit silently fails if "push to remote" is checked by default but no remote is set

fields.description:
In Search View, there is an option to search 'Branches' instead of 'Commit Message'.

However, searching for branches option is not working.
fields.summary: Searching branches in Search View not working

fields.description: Since the 1.9.2 update, the tree view in the "File Status" view has completely disappeared. This makes it really not easy to find a file in the list of all files, say to look at History of a file, or any other action you would want to do on a file that is not currently being modified. In complex hierarchies of files, looking at the whole list of files in a flat view is a real nightmare.
fields.summary: Impossible to navigate files in tree mode

fields.description:
When a submodule is changed, and when clicking on it in the staging list, the diff is not shown anymore, so it's impossible to know to what commit it was pointing before, and to what commit it's pointing now.

This was working in earlier versions of SourceTree, before updating to 1.9.2. Now it says "No preview available".
It looks like this is only happening when there is a conflict on the submodule commit to choose, which is exactly when you need it the most!
fields.summary: Git submodule diff not shown anymore

fields.description: Tower has the ability to drag a branch onto the current branch and merge. Something like this would be nice to see in SourceTree
fields.summary: Implement drag and drop for merging

fields.description: The icons for Tower (your competitor) are much cleaner and lightweight. I'd like to see the icons in the interface to SourceTree be the same way as they distract from the UI right now.
fields.summary: Please consider less "clunky" icons

fields.description: The font for the commit list is too small and doesn't look clean. I'd like the ability to customize it just like I can set it for the diffs.
fields.summary: Please allow for font customization in commit list

fields.description:
The new Pending Files view poses a UX problem due to its use of checkboxes that cause the list of files to re-order when a checkbox is checked.

Checkboxes should only indicate state, not cause an action to be performed. 

If a user has a long list of unstaged files, they often wish to stage a few files for a commit by quickly clicking their associated checkboxes. This causes the file to move to the Staged list, and the "Unstaged files" header to jump down a row. If the file is the first file to be staged, it causes the creation and insertion of the "Staged files" header, thus causing the "Unstaged files" header to appear next in the list.

Users will often then accidentally click the "Unstaged files" header, which in turn stages all files.

Compounding this problem is the fact that the staging process is not immediate. The UI is blocked by the source control staging process.

These problems did not exist with the previous drag-and-drop implementation.

The problem can be mitigated by always have the "Staged Files" header regardless of whether any files have been staged.
fields.summary: New Pending Files view poses interaction problems

fields.description:
Staging a huge number of files (100-300) will make the spinner running forever.
h3.Workaround
Use CMD+R to refresh it
fields.summary: Staging huge number of files will make the spinner running forever

fields.description:
Sometimes it is much more faster to execute some commands in terminal, e.g. hg pull && hg up some_branch.
It's nice that there is a "Terminal" button on tool panel of SourceTree which opens a terminal in the repo directory.

But it would be much more convenient if there was a small text box (just like "commit message") where you can type those commands.
fields.summary: Integrate terminal command line directly to repo window
